Hi,

2003 22:05 schrieb javainsel:
> Its strange that this forum uses censorship=
 system before the

I can't see any censorship.

> I was =
and am serious, all the time.
Really.

> Forget now about DbC. We can discu=
ss about it later (in a few

That's a really good idea=
.

> Somehow I can't imagine to use Mock objects without our framework to
>=
 support it.

cations
> with the framework and the know how is not good yet.

> What mean=
s SPI?
Service Provider Interface.

> I just want to use Mock objects for t=
he database. The test data must
> be coming
> from the test classes and not=
 be inside the database. So we need
> Mock objects
> I think. But I don't k=
now how to create them since I still don't
> know how
> our framework works=
 inside and how Mock objects are used.
>
> Now you think it is not necessar=
y that our framework supports Mock
> objects?
Probably not.
So you want to =
test your part of the code or the framework?
If you want to test your part =
of the code, let your mock objects implement the 
interfaces and extend the=
 stubs (abstract classes) of the framework.
If you want to test the framewo=
rk, replace the JDBC parts by a mock 
implementation.
